messages.title: Campaigning to save the Legion
messages.content: The closure of the Legion Club is a real blow for residents and ex-Service people in Camberley. The Tories are letting us lose yet another community resource. Matt has been campaigning hard to save it but while the Legion may have closed we may seem to be losing the battle, we haven't lost the war.

messages.title: Working for you
messages.content: Surrey Heath has been transformed since 1997. On the doorsteps most people agree that areas like Old Dean, Watchetts and St Michaels have really benefited from new investment, extra police and Sure Start Centres. In contrast the Tories offer only cuts such as to the local childcare, leisure and increased rates for dial-a-ride. Labour is bursting with new ideas: free personal care for those with high needs; guaranteed cancer diagnosis within a week; learning and further education for all school leavers or fair decisions on how we reduce the national debt.

messages.title: My priorities for Surrey Heath
messages.content: Prevent another shambles like the Mosque planning fiasco; Stop Surrey County Council cutting bus services; Solve the traffic congestion around Frimley Park Hospital; Hold Surrey Tories to account over their failure to claim central government money for new schools; To be open and honest about expenses.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: A huge skill gap is preventing our children on realising their place for the workforce of the future. Everyone needs at least six GCSEs to be considered a skilled worker.
Guarantee to see cancer patients diagnosis within one week of GP referral and ensure fair prescription - abolishing the existing postcode lottery. A new competition within the NHS.
First Social Bill of our new government focusing on the minority of families and people without a voice.
Tackling crime and anti-social behaviour, our rising crime, fighting for growth rates and growth levels.

issues.economy: Labour is bursting with new ideas: learning and further education for all school leavers or fair decisions on how we reduce the national debt.
issues.education: Learning and further education for all school leavers
issues.governance: To be open and honest about expenses.
issues.health: Guarantee cancer diagnosis within a week; free personal care for those with high needs.

leaflet.personalStatement: Labour made the right decisions to protect jobs, businesses and homes - it has been tough but don't let the Tories put the recovery at risk now.
